name: appRoleAssignment
description: Used to record when a user or group is assigned to an application. In this case, the role assignment will result in an application tile showing up on the user's app access panel. This entity may also be used to grant another application (modeled as a service principal) access to a resource application in a particular role. You can create, read, update, and delete role assignments. Inherits from [DirectoryObject].

properties.name: creationTimestamp
properties.description: The time when the grant was created.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The role id that was assigned to the principal.  This role must be declared by the target resource application **resourceId** in its **appRoles** property. Where the resource does not declare any permissions, a default id (zero GUID) must be specified.                            **Notes**: not nullable.

properties.name: principalDisplayName
properties.description: The display name of the principal that was granted the access.

properties.name: principalId
properties.description: The unique identifier (**objectId**) for the principal being granted the access.                            **Notes**: required.

properties.name: principalType
properties.description: The type of principal.  This can either be "User", "Group" or "ServicePrincipal".

properties.name: resourceDisplayName
properties.description: The display name of the resource to which the assignment was made.

properties.name: resourceId
properties.description: The unique identifier (**objectId**) for the target resource (service principal) for which the assignment was made.
